intro: Bupleurum baldense var. multicaule, commonly known as the multicaule bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic foliage and often hollow stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring compound leaves with serrated edges and small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
